Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, marginal value on some kit items.
Reviews.Author: owen faler
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera and very intuitive given the multitude of functions.  Five stars for the camera, three stars for the kit.  I won't bore you about the camera as it is excellent and you can find several excellent reviews on You-Tube to support my findings.  The kit however, has shortcomings:  The camera bag is  cheap and small, the camera strap is cheap, the flash is cheap, the added filters are irrelevant (camera has built-in filter options) and the added micro & macro lens add-ons are probably not much use.  Given the high quality of the camera you are not going to use cheap lens add-ons to deteriorate picture quality, just buy the required lens.  The tri-pod & mono-pod are useful, as well as the extra batteries and charger.  So, overall, this kit is an okay value because of the camera, Pentax lenses, extra batteries and tripod/monopod.  You could buy the camera and key-kit-items for a similar price on Amazon with a little research. My recommendation, is the seller to get rid of the cheap kit items and adjust price.  This is a pro-camera deserving of quality supporting hardware.  The cheap kit items are insulting given the camera quality.

Reviews.Title: will never buy bundles again
Reviews.Author: Sergei Protasov
Reviews.Content: The Pentax K-IIs body was all right and both lenses too. But the memory card (16 gig) was out of order, the flashlight was a cheap toy and the extension lenses do not work with the main  lenses. Still I have not overpaid. The price was fair.

Reviews.Content: Pretty good. The kit has comprehensive items. The quality of the lenses is good and the camera is new. The box was damaged a little when it arrived, but it's alright.
